chapter.title: Using Foreign Exchange module
chapter.para: This chapter describes the functions of the Foreign Exchange (FX) module and explains how to perform FX transactions using Opics Portal.

section.title: About Foreign Exchange (FX)
section.para: The Foreign Exchange module performs front and back office processing including deal entry, position management, profit & loss, back office controls, confirmations, payment messages, accounting, and interfaces.
Opics Portal facilitates initiating FX contracts and submitting them to the Issuing Bank for the following instruments:

listitem.para: Spot
Forward
Swaps
Delivery Options

section.para: It also processes flexible transaction types like splits, options (takedowns, uptakes, and extends) and non-delivery forwards (NDFs) to support the demands of both interbank and corporate trading activities.
The subsequent sections provides detailed explanation about FX transactions such as, deal capturing, pricing, position management, confirmations, accounting, and interfaces.

section.title: FX Deals
section.para: Using Opics Portal, you can request for price of an FX deal by providing basic transaction details. The portal forwards the request to Opics Plus and, based on the data associated with your account, the back-end application returns the all-in customer price for the transaction. The displayed result stands valid for a specific time interval within which you can accept the price offered by the bank to complete the transaction or reject it.

note.para: During the time that a price is active, if you make any modification to the deal, the existing offered price is cancelled and you must place a fresh request for the FX deal.

section.para: The process of creating FX deals is similar for all FX instruments mentioned above. In the portal Home page, click Foreign Exchange and select the required instrument type, for example Spot.

section.title: Creating an FX Deal (Spot)
section.para: The input form and its respective fields are described in the following tables.

section.para: Specify the following under General Details section.

section.para: Specify the following under Request For Quote section.

The request for price is submitted to the bank where the back-end would calculate and offer you with the applicable rate for the trade.
Other types of FX transactions display additional fields depending on the type of FX transaction selected in the portal.

This field can be different from the near currency amount and defaults to the near amount if the far amount is blank and the 'Request' button has been selected.

section.para: The Request For Quote section contains additional field as described below.

tip.para: : Enter this field for forward deals only. Its value must be greater than or equal to the deal date and less than the value date.

section.title: Accepting or Rejecting Price
section.para: On receiving the rate offered by the bank, you can click the following buttons to decide the future of the FX transaction:

listitem.para: Accept : Completes the transaction and provides a visual confirmation of the deal details along with the deal number assigned by the back-end system. You can follow the given link to view or assign standing instructions for the transaction.

tip.para: : Opics Plus can accept a price or a deal even after the price has timed out or expired, if the price proves to be beneficial for the bank

listitem.para: Reject : Cancels the transaction. You can modify transaction details and resubmit a request. The portal notifies the back-end system that the price is rejected so that it can update the trader’s e-trading blotter.

section.title: Types of Pricing
section.para: Opics Plus supports two types of pricing mechanism for a trade–Manual and Automated.

section.title: Automated Pricing
section.para: If the customer is configured for automated pricing and the deal is within specified limits, Opics Plus prices the transaction from real time market data feed, without manual intervention and provides it to the customer.

However, if the transaction falls outside certain pre-determined parameters (for example, the amount specified in the request exceeds the limit) it is sent to the bank’s traders for manual pricing. This leads to delay in returning the price to the user.

The portal displays a message if manual pricing is taking place or if the pricing request expires. In both cases, you can choose to continue waiting or stop the request. If you stop the request, Opics Portal sends a message to the back-end system indicating that the request is cancelled.

section.title: Manual Pricing
section.para: In manual pricing, the price for a trade is not derived from market data. The back-end system calculates the applicable price and provides it to the customer.

section.title: Sending Message to Bank
section.para: Opics Portal facilitates sending messages to the bank to view and add standing instructions or to modify an existing transaction.

section.title: Viewing Standing Instructions
section.para: From the Main Menu, click Foreign Exchange and then under Message to Bank, click Standing Instructions. A list of records is displayed for all FX transactions. Click the System ID of a transaction to view the details of the transaction.
The following details are displayed under Customer Payment Instruction section.

section.para: Under Bank Payment Instructions, the instruction types are as follows.

listitem.para: Bank Instructions : Indicates the standing instructions assigned by the bank.
Free Format Instructions : Select this option to add standing instructions if it does not exist or to override instructions for the FX transaction from the portal.

note.para: : Manually entered instructions require authorization by a bank agent before the payments are generated.

section.title: Adding Standing Instructions
section.para: To add standing instruction using Opics Portal, under Bank Payment Instructions section, select Instructions type as Free Format Instructions and click Ok in the confirmation message-box.

You can specify Additional Details about the beneficiary, such as payment type (Wire or Draft), beneficiary name, address, account number, beneficiary bank details, etc., and click Submit to add payment instructions for the FX transaction.

section.title: Modifying an Existing FX Transaction
section.para: Using Opics Portal, you can make certain modifications to an existing FX transaction based on the type of transaction.

listitem.para: From the Main Menu, click Foreign Exchange and then under Message to Bank, click From Existing FX.
In the Ccy field, specify the currency of the FX transaction that needs to be modified and click Search. A list of records is displayed for all FX transactions with the specified currency.
Click the System ID of a transaction to open the transaction for modification.
Select appropriate Actions from the Action Details section.
For a Spot and Forward FX Transaction, you can perform the following actions:
Split : Divides the currency amount or the counter currency amount into two parts.
Extend : Extends the value date of the transaction to a future date.
Uptake: Shortens the value date of the transaction to a closer date.
For a Delivery Option FX Transaction, you can perform the following action:
Takedown : Modifies the amount involved in the deal.

note.para: For Swap FX transactions, No Possible Action can be taken as these transactions cannot be modified from the portal.

section.title: Performing an FX Inquiry
section.para: Opics Portal provides information about the status, the details, and the history of transactions initiated by the user. The list of transactions is confined to those transactions entered on the current processing date.
You can perform inquiries on Spot/Forward, Swap, Delivery Options, or all FX transactions as follows:

listitem.para: From the Main Menu, click Foreign Exchange and then under FX Inquiry, click the required transaction type.
In the Ccy field, specify the currency of the FX transaction.
Select the Output Format to display on Screen, or save the results in CSV or Spreadsheet.
Click Search to display the list of records of FX transactions with the specified currency.
Click the System ID of a transaction to view the details of a particular transaction.

tip.para: : You can use wildcards in your search string. For example, type *MYTEXT* to search for the items containing the MYTEXT string. Moreover, you can also filter or sort the information returned from the portal on a multi or single column basis.
